required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.official_title: A Preliminary Evaluation of an Exposure-Based Treatment for Perfectionism

brief_summary.textblock: This study is examining the efficacy of a computerized, exposure-based, intervention for perfectionism.

detailed_description.textblock: The primary aim of this study is to evaluate the effects of a two-week computerized exposure-based treatment for perfectionism (ETP). Individuals with elevated perfectionism will be randomly assigned to ETP or a waitlist (WL) control condition. ETP will consist of three tasks in which they will repeatedly make mistakes, repeated for five sessions over a two-week period (one session every 3 days).

primary_outcome.measure: Frost Multidimensional Perfectionism Scale (FMPS)- Concern Over Mistakes Subscale
primary_outcome.time_frame: Change in levels of perfectionism from baseline to post treatment (2 weeks)
primary_outcome.description: Self-report questionnaire examining levels of perfectionism. The concern over mistakes sub-scale includes 9 items with scores ranging from 9 to 45 (higher scores signify higher levels of perfectionism).

secondary_outcome.measure: Center for Epidemiological Studies Depression Scale (CES-D)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Change in depression symptoms from baseline to post treatment (2 weeks)
secondary_outcome.description: Self-report measure used to assess depressive symptoms. Total scores range from 0 to 60 with higher scores indicating a higher level of depressive symptoms.

secondary_outcome.measure: State-Trait Inventory for Cognitive and Somatic Anxiety-Trait Version (STICSA-T)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Change in overall anxiety symptoms from baseline to post treatment (2 weeks)
secondary_outcome.description: Self-report measure used to assess overall anxiety symptoms. Scores range from 21 to 84 with higher scores indicating higher levels of overall anxiety.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Change in social anxiety symptoms from baseline to post treatment (2 weeks)
secondary_outcome.description: Self-report scale that measures Social anxiety symptoms. Scores range from 0 to 68 with higher scores indicating higher levels of social anxiety symptoms.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Change in eating disorder symptoms from baseline to post treatment (2 weeks)
secondary_outcome.description: Self-report scale that measures eating disorder symptoms. Scores range from 0 to 78 with higher scores indicating higher levels of eating disorder symptoms.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Change in obsessive-compulsiveness from baseline to post treatment (2 weeks)
secondary_outcome.description: Self-report scale that measures obsessive-compulsiveness. Scores range from 0 to 72 with higher scores indicating higher levels of obsessive-compulsiveness.

arm_group.description: This arm consists of a 2-week computerized, exposure-based intervention. Treatment sessions are completed every 3 days at home (5 treatment sessions total).
Participants in this condition will not receive treatment.

intervention.description: Three tasks focused on exposures are completed. Each treatment session is approximately twenty minutes.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Score of at least 29 on the Frost Multidimensional Perfectionism Scale- Concern over Mistakes subscale
Exclusion Criteria:
- Current moderate or severe substance use disorder, psychotic disorder, or bipolar disorder
- Current suicidal ideation (imminent risk)
- Currently participating in psychotherapy
- Any changes to psychotropic medications in the past four weeks

facility.name: Florida State University, Department of Psychology
